thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Daily earnings results round-up

author: news.com.au
title: Daily earnings results round-up
text:
RESULTS ROUND-UP
AUSDRILL Summary: Resource sector falls anchored the mining services group's fall in profit, but the board believes the downturn may be close to its bottom.
Loss: $175.6m, compared to a $43.9m loss Share price: up 1.5 cents at 22.5 cents BILLABONG Summary: Surf's up for the beachgear and surfwear retailing group after it posted its first full year profit in four years. Profit: $4.2m, up from a $234m loss Share price: up 1.5 cents at 64.5 cents BORAL Summary: the building products supplier's annual profit jumped nearly 50 per cent but its expectations of a softening in the housing market disappointed. Profit: $257m, up from $173m Share price: down 50 cents at $5.78 FLIGHT CENTRE Summary: Record sales on its international front helped the travel company lift annual profit. Profit: $256.6m, up from $206.9m Share price: up $3.72 at $36.01 NINE ENTERTAINMENT Summary: Massive writedowns and challenging competition in the TV market dragged the broadcaster into the red in the year. Loss: $592m, compared to $64m profit Share price: up five cents at $1.50 RAMSAY HEALTH CARE Summary: The country's largest private hospital operator is looking at international expansion including China after a boost from its dominant position in France helped lift annual profit. Profit: $385.6m, up from $303.8m Share price: up $3.34 at $63.68 RETAIL FOOD GROUP Summary: Costs from acquiring the Gloria Jean's cafe chain and other food businesses dented the bottom line of the company behind Donut King and Brumby's bakeries, though annual underlying profit soared. Profit: $32.4m, down from $38.6m Share price: up 48 cents at $5.28 SOUTHERN CROSS AUSTEREO Summary: The media company posted another heavy annual loss from writedowns to its radio and regional TV businesses, while underlying profit also fell. Loss: $284.95m, compared to a $296m loss Share price: up 1.5 cents at 93 cents TRANSFIELD SERVICES Summary: The Nauru detention centre operator and infrastructure firm experienced a rise in underlying earnings but one-off costs weighed on its annual profit. Profit: $48.6m, down from $55m Share price: up 3.5 cents at $1.04
